subject: Technology
title: Color TV: The World Gets Vivid
description: One-minute skill: Color TV: The World Gets Vivid.

hook.text: When color TV arrived, audiences were stunned. Shows they'd watched in grey suddenly burst into living color.

buildup.text: Color TV was demonstrated as early as 1940 but took decades to become affordable and widely adopted.

discovery.text: Color TVs use three electron beams: red, green, and blue. Combined, they create every color the human eye can see.

twist.text: NBC's peacock logo was created specifically to showcase color to viewers who still had black-and-white sets.

climax.text: By the 1970s, most American homes had color TVs. Black-and-white sets became relics within a single generation.

punchline.text: Color TV didn't change what we watched. It transformed how we saw it.

quiz.question: Why was NBC's peacock logo created?
options: As a tribute to the founder's favorite bird
To showcase color broadcasting to viewers with black-and-white sets
